H0.text: What ore is the chief source of aluminium. Corundum

H1.text: What ore is the chief source of aluminium. Cryolite

H2.text: What ore is the chief source of aluminium. Garnet

H3.text: What ore is the chief source of aluminium. Boxite

A4.text: Aluminium oxide is dissolved at a temperature of about 960 °C in molten cryolite.

A5.text: Bauxite is the world's main source of aluminium.

A6.text: Aluminium also occurs in the minerals beryl, cryolite, garnet, spinel, and turquoise.

A7.text: It is obtained industrially by mining bauxite, a sedimentary rock rich in aluminium minerals.

A8.text: It is the world's main source of aluminium and gallium.

A9.text: Bauxite consists mostly of the aluminium minerals gibbsite (Al(OH)3), boehmite (γ-AlO(OH)), and diaspore (α-AlO(OH)), mixed with the two iron oxides goethite (FeO(OH)) and hematite (Fe2O3), the aluminium clay mineral kaolinite (Al2Si2O5(OH)4) and small amounts of anatase (TiO2) and ilmenite (FeTiO3 or FeO·TiO2).
